page.title: 05Tetra Pak Case Study
page.content: This is a world wide company making wax covered containers to hold a variety of liquids. In 1984 more than 2,000 million cartons were produced for customers throughout the U.K.. Very large rolls of paper are put into printing presses and this continuous process have the patterns and names printed on to them bonded on to plastic cut to shape ready for folding and filling by the customers. It is highly mechanised and extremly clean. The workforce is entirely male and they drive fork lift trucks to move the raw materials. There are plans to extend the factory which include changing the channel of the river Clywedog. The aim is to double production by 1988. The men work a two shift system and there are very good realationships between managment and staff.
